alert.note: Alert for Miller; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson, northern Decatur, Miller, southwestern Mitchell, southwestern Baker and Seminole Counties through 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/... At 115 PM EDT/1215 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Marianna, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Donalsonville, Bainbridge, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Iron City, Brinson, Bascom, Hanover, Ausmac, Babcock, Reynoldsville, Little Hope, Decatur Co A/P, Lovedale, Boykin and Dellwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
